## 1

```{python}

def grades(di):
  cnt = 0
  for g in di.values():
    if g >= 60:
      cnt += 1
  return cnt

gdi = {"Mike": 60,
"Li": 92,
"Joan": 88,
"Trevor": 58,
"Betsy": 73}

grades(gdi)
```

## 2

```{python}
def grades_2(di):
  li = []
  for key, value in di.items():
    if value >= 60:
      li.append(key)
  return li

gdi = {"Mike": 78,
"Li": 92,
"Joan": 88,
"Trevor": 58,
"Betsy": 73}

grades_2(gdi)

```

## 3

```{python}
# can't remove items in place when looping
def grades_3(di):
  values_in_di = list(di.values())
  keys_in_di = list(di.keys())
  for i in range(1, len(values_in_di)):
    if values_in_di[i] < 60:
      di.pop(keys_in_di[i])
  return di

grades_3(gdi)
```

```{python}
# can't remove items in place when looping
def reverse(di):
  newdi = {}
  for key, value in di.items():
    newdi[value] = key
  return newdi

gdi = {3: 5, 22: 10, 4: 42, 20: 6}

reverse(gdi)
```
